Protecting Keys with TruecryptÂ¶

The EDC is designed to run on a secure server or an independent mobile device such as a netbook. In the latter case, securing the encryption keys is an important concern and storing the keys in a truecrypt encrypted mountable file is one approach.

Tip

See BHP’s SOP on managing netbooks deployed in a disconnected environment

Download, install and create a truecrypt encrypted file:

http://www.truecrypt.org/downloads

Point bhp_crypto to the truecrypt encrypted file by editing the KEY_PATH attribute in the project settings file. For example, if the truecrypt volume project_keys is mounted and the keys are in a sub-folder named keys:

On macosx:

KEY_PATH='/Volume/project_keys/keys'

On ubuntu:

KEY_PATH='/media/project_keys/keys'
